text: Muti Randolph is a Brazilian architect and designer. He has designed retail locations of Melissa Shoes, a division of Grendene.https://gq.globo.com/Cultura/Musica/noticia/2018/03/muti-randolph- designer-da-d-edge-fala-sobre-arte-e-sustentabilidade.html In 1996 he designed the São Paulo nightclub U Turn. In 2011 Randolph was responsible, in tandem with the architects Marcelo Pontes, Paula Zemel and Eduardo Chalabi, for the redesign (from the original vision of the Franco- Brazilian firm of Triptyque) of the D-Edge electronic music club in the Barra Funda neighborhood of São Paulo.http://architectism.com/d-edge-muti-randolph-marcelo-pontes-zemel- chalabi-arquitetos/ For the Nike effort at the 2016 Summer Olympics in Rio de Janeiro, "Rio Sem Limites" (Rio Without Limits), Randolph did "A 100-square- meter cube of multiple moving screens" which displayed.. "colorful graphic projections".https://www.freshnessmag.com/2016/08/05/nike-rio-unlimited- experience/ Randolph's "entry sequence" for Melissa Shoes' SoHo, New York City store has been described by "Interior Design" as a "veritable tunnel of crisscrossing LEDs surrounded by mirrors". ==References== Category:Brazilian architects Category:Interior designers Category:Living people Category:Year of birth missing (living people)
title: Muti Randolph
